member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountDetails
member.summary: Contains all of the information about a users account that is received in in response to a login request.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountDetails.#ctor(System.Int64,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new object representing the user's account
member.param: The unique ID of the account
The username
The base currency of the account
The legal entity the account is based in, e.g. UK, Germany etc
The Locale used for displaying information (i.e. language)
True if the account is enabled for funding

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountDetails.AccountId
member.summary: Readonly, the numeric system accountId.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountDetails.Username
member.summary: The username used to login to the LMAX Trader platform.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountDetails.Currency
member.summary: The user's base currency.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountDetails.LegalEntity
member.summary: The legal entity where the user is located, e.g. UK.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountDetails.DisplayLocale
member.summary: The locale used to display text, mainly used by the UI to handle internationalisation.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountDetails.FundingAllowed
member.summary: If funding is enabled for the account.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountStateEvent
member.summary: A event that contains all of the top level information about an account's current state.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountStateEvent.AccountId

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountStateEvent.Balance

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountStateEvent.AvailableFunds
member.summary: Get the account's available funds.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountStateEvent.AvailableToWithdraw
member.summary: Get the amount that this account is available to withdraw.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountStateEvent.UnrealisedProfitAndLoss

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountStateEvent.Margin
member.summary: Get the account's total margin.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountStateEvent.Wallets
member.summary: Get the account's balances by currency. The Dictionary is keyed by 3 letter currency symbol, e.g. GBP.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.LmaxApiOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an LmaxApiOptions object with default values of: DefaultConnectionLimit = 5 ClientIdentifier = ""

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.LmaxApiOptions.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an LmaxApiOptions object with default values of: DefaultConnectionLimit = 5
member.param: Identifies the client in HTTP requests for diagnostic purposes (25 characters permitted).

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.LmaxApiOptions.ClientIdentifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the ClientIdentifier, used to identify the client in HTTP requests for diagnostic purposes (25 characters permitted).

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.LmaxApiOptions.DefaultConnectionLimit
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent connections allowed by a System.Net.ServicePoint object per login.
Note: the larger the value, the more resources used by the API (more sockets openened, threads created, etc.)

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.FailureResponse
member.summary: Generalised failure response that is produced whenever a request to the API is made. Indicates the failure response and a descriptive message along with a flag to indicate if this is a system failure (e.g. connection error) or an application failure (e.g. invalid price).

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.FailureResponse.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Constructs a failure response object with all values.
member.param: True if the problem is with the system, e.g. a network problem
Short message of the failure
Readable description of the problem
The captured Exception

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.FailureResponse.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a failure response object
member.param: True if the problem is with the system, e.g. a network problem
Short message of the failure

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.FailureResponse.#ctor(System.Exception,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a failure response object
member.param: Readable description of the problem
The captured Exception

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.FailureResponse.IsSystemFailure
member.summary: A readonly property that indicates that this failure was caused by some sort of system failure, most likely a connection error.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.FailureResponse.Message
member.summary: A readonly property that contains the error message that occured.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.FailureResponse.Description
member.summary: A readonly property that a more user friendly description of the error, may be an empty string.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.FailureResponse.Exception
member.summary: A readonly property that holds an exception, if this failiure was caused by an exception. Will be null otherwise.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession
member.summary: The main interface for interacting with the Lmax Trader platform. This interface can be shared across multiple threads.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.Subscribe(Com.Lmax.Api.ISubscriptionRequest,Com.Lmax.Api.OnSuccess,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Subscribe to the events from an OrderBook. This includes Market Data, i.e. changes to the current best prices and the depth
member.param: An indicating the types of events to subscribe to.
An that will be called if the subscription request is successful.
An that will be called if the request fails, a will be provided containing the details of the failure.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.PlaceMarketOrder(Com.Lmax.Api.Order.MarketOrderSpecification,Com.Lmax.Api.OnInstructionResponse,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Place a market order onto the Lmax Trader platform. This will response with an instruction id that can be used to trace the state of an order. The response to this call will be return before the order is actually placed on the exchange. The execution reports and order responses will come back through an asynchronous event.
member.param: The specification of the market order to be placed contains instrumentId, quantity etc.
A called when an order has been validated and passed onto the broker.
A called if the call to place the order has failed.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.PlaceLimitOrder(Com.Lmax.Api.Order.LimitOrderSpecification,Com.Lmax.Api.OnInstructionResponse,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Place a limit order onto the Lmax Trader platform. This will respond with an instruction id that can be used to trace the state of an order. The response to this call will occur before the order is actually placed on the exchange. The execution reports and order responses will come back through an asynchronous event.
member.param: The specification of the market order to be placed contains instrumentId, quantity etc.
A called when an order has been validated and passed onto the broker.
A called if the call to place the order has failed.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.PlaceClosingOrder(Com.Lmax.Api.Order.ClosingOrderSpecification,Com.Lmax.Api.OnInstructionResponse,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Close the specified quantity on an instrument position. The response to this call will occur before the order is actually placed on the exchange. The execution reports and order responses will come back through an asynchronous event.
member.param: The specification containing the details of which position to close and for what quantity
A called when an order has been validated and passed onto the broker.
A called if the call to close the order has failed.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.PlaceStopOrder(Com.Lmax.Api.Order.StopOrderSpecification,Com.Lmax.Api.OnInstructionResponse,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Place a stop order onto the Lmax Trader platform. This will response with an instruction id that can be used to trace the state of an order. The response to this call will be return before the order is actually placed on the exchange. The execution reports and order responses will come back through an asynchronous event.
member.param: The specification of the stop order to be placed contains instrumentId, quantity etc.
A called when an order has been validated and passed onto the broker.
A called if the call to place the order has failed.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.CancelOrder(Com.Lmax.Api.Order.CancelOrderRequest,Com.Lmax.Api.OnInstructionResponse,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Cancel an order that has already be placed in the exchange. This will need the instruction id of the original order. This request will also have its own instruction id which can be used to trace an rejections of the cancellation.
member.param: An order cancellation request containing the original orders instruction id
A called when an order has been validated and passed onto the broker.
A called if the call to place the order has failed.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.AmendStops(Com.Lmax.Api.Order.AmendStopLossProfitRequest,Com.Lmax.Api.OnInstructionResponse,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Amend the stop loss and/or profit on an existing order.
member.param: An amend order request containing a reference to the original order and the new stop loss/profit offsets
A called when the amendment has been validated and passed onto the broker.
Will be called when the attempt to amend order fails. For further details

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.RequestAccountState(Com.Lmax.Api.Account.AccountStateRequest,Com.Lmax.Api.OnSuccess,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Request an update of the account state. This will get the Lmax Trader platform to push an update of the account state back down the stream event channel. It will not be returned directly. Use the AccountStateUpdated event to receive the update.
member.param: The request for account state
A called if the call to request the account state has failed.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.RequestHistoricMarketData(Com.Lmax.Api.MarketData.IHistoricMarketDataRequest,Com.Lmax.Api.OnSuccess,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Get the historic market data for a specific instrument. Will return a list of URLs that point to to CSV files that include the months that were requested.
member.param: The request for historic market data, will contain an instrument id and a date range
A called if the request is accepted and is being processed.
A called if the call to request the historic market data has failed.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.RequestHeartbeat(Com.Lmax.Api.Account.HeartbeatRequest,Com.Lmax.Api.OnSuccess,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Request that the server sends back a heartbeat event with the specified token.
member.param: The request for a heartbeat.
A called if the request is accepted and is being processed.
A called if the call to request the heartbeat has failed.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.SearchInstruments(Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.SearchRequest,Com.Lmax.Api.OnSearchResponse,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Request the instruments. The instruments will not returned in this call, but will cause the system to generate an asynchronous event(s) containing the information. Instrument information is paged, on the callback will be a boolean value indicating if there are any more values to be received. The last instrumentId should be used as the offsetInstrumentId on the subsequent request. The results will be returned ordered by instrument name.
member.param: The request for instruments
Will be called if the request succeeds.
A called if the call to request the instruments has failed.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.OpenUri(System.Uri,Com.Lmax.Api.OnUriResponse,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Open a data url from the Lmax Trader platform.
member.param: The uri of the file to open
Will be called if the request succeeds.
A called if the call fails.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.Start
member.summary: Starts the event processing loop. This method blocks while it is reading events from asynchronous stream interface. This method should be the very last action from within the callback. The implementation will prevent this method from being called more than once. It is not vaild to call this method multiple times from different threads.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.Stop
member.summary: Stops the event processing loop.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.Logout(Com.Lmax.Api.OnSuccess,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary:
Logout from the exchange. You should stop listening to events first.
Will be called when the logout request suceeds. Will be called when the logout request fails.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.AccountDetails
member.summary: Readonly property contain the details of the users Account, id, locale etc.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.Id
member.summary: Readonly property containing the web session id assigned to this session.

member.name: E:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.MarketDataChanged
member.summary: Fired whenever an order book event that represents a change in the market data occurs. Orderbooks need to be subscribed to before events will be fired. A market data change includes changes to the best price and the depth.

member.name: E:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.OrderBookStatusChanged
member.summary: Fired whenever an order book event that represents a change in the order book status occurs. Use an OrderBookStatusSubscriptionRequest to subscribe to these events.

member.name: E:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.EventStreamFailed
member.summary: Fired whenever an Exception occurs while reading from the event stream. This could occur, for example, due to the connection being dropped.

member.name: E:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.EventStreamSessionDisconnected
member.summary: Fired whenever the session was disconnected on the server and the event stream closed. The session can no longer be used. In order to continue, a new session must be created by logging in again.

member.name: E:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.PositionChanged
member.summary: Fired whenever a position changes, normally the result of a new order, fill cancel etc.

member.name: E:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.OrderExecuted
member.summary: Fired when a execution occurs as the result of an action that occurs on an order, e.g. order filling.

member.name: E:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.OrderChanged
member.summary: Fired when there is a change to the state of an order

member.name: E:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.InstructionRejected
member.summary: Fired when an instruction id rejected.

member.name: E:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.AccountStateUpdated
member.summary: Fired when an account state event is received. May be the result of a request. Use an AccountSubscriptionRequest to subscribe to AccountStateEvents.

member.name: E:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.HistoricMarketDataReceived
member.summary: Fired when the requested historic market data is received. Use RequestHistoricMarketData to request historic market data.

member.name: E:Com.Lmax.Api.ISession.HeartbeatReceived
member.summary: Fired when a heartbeat is received. Use RequestHeartbeat to request a heartbeat be sent.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Internal.Session.Logout(Com.Lmax.Api.OnSuccess,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary:
logout from the exchange. You should stop listening to events first.
Will be called when the logout request suceeds. Will be called when the logout request fails.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Internal.Session.StreamRequest.WriteTo(Com.Lmax.Api.Internal.Xml.IStructuredWriter)
member.summary: Internal: Output this request.
member.param: The destination for the content of this request

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnSuccess
member.summary: Simple delegate for successful asynchronous call.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure
member.summary: Standard failure delegate for asynchronous calls.
member.param: Contains the details of the failure

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnLogin
member.summary: Delegate for a successful login to the LMAX API. Implementations can then use the session to interact with the API.
member.param: The session to use when interacting with the API

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnOrderBookEvent
member.summary: Delagate for processing OrderBookEvents. Events for all order books that have been subscribed to will be delivered to this delegate.
member.param: Details of the order book event fired

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnOrderBookStatusEvent
member.summary: Delagate for processing order book status events. Events for status changes of all order books that have been subscribed to will be delivered to this delegate.
member.param: Details of the order book status event fired

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnException
member.summary: Delegate to handle Exceptions
member.param: The exception that occurred

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnSessionDisconnected
member.summary: Delegate for session disconnected. The session can no longer be used. In order to continue, a new session must be created by logging in again.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnInstructionResponse
member.summary: Delegate to handle a response containing an instructionId - most usually in response to place/cancel/amend order requests
member.param: The instructionId returned by the LMAX API

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnPositionEvent
member.summary: Delegate for processing events on all positions that have been subscribed to
member.param: Contains details of the updated position

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnExecutionEvent
member.summary: Delegate to deal with executions - for example, if an order has filled
member.param: The information about the execution that occurred

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnOrderEvent
member.summary: Delegate to process changes in an order.
member.param: The updated Order

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnRejectionEvent
member.summary: If an instruction (for example, placing an order) is rejected, this delegate will be called. An OnRejectionEvent delegate must be registered for the client to process rejections.
member.param: Details of why the instruction was rejected

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnAccountStateEvent
member.summary: Delegate for dealing with updates to the user's account, for example if the account balance changes.
member.param: The updated account state

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnHistoricMarketDataEvent
member.summary: Delegate that is called when historic market data events are received asynchronously. Note that the provided URIs require a valid authentication token which can be retrieved from .
member.param: the ID of the instruction that requested this data.
the URIs to the historic market data covering the requested date range. Empty if there is no data available for the requested date range.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnMarketDataEvent
member.summary: Delegate that is called market data asynchronous request is returned. Note that the provided URIs require a valid authentication token which can be retrieved from .
member.param: the ID of the instruction that requested this data.
the URIs to the market data covering the requested date range for the requested criteria. Empty if there is no data available for the requested date range.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnHeartbeatReceivedEvent
member.summary: Delegate that is called when an asynchronous heartbeat event is received.
member.param: the heartbeat token from the request that caused this heartbeat to be sent.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnSearchResponse
member.summary: Delegate called when the search for instruments returns. This returns a batch of instruments, if the full number of search results is bigger than the batch size, the returned list will only contain a subset of the results, and hasMoreResults will be true.
member.param: A batch of search results. If the full list of results is longer than the batch size, this will be a partial set of results.
Set to true if there are more results to retrieve

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OnUriResponse
member.summary: Delegate called when the open uri request returns.
member.param: The uri requested
The response content

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.TimeInForce
member.summary: The time in force policy applicable to orders.

member.name: F:Com.Lmax.Api.TimeInForce.FillOrKill
member.summary: An order with this value must fill completely, or it will be cancelled.

member.name: F:Com.Lmax.Api.TimeInForce.ImmediateOrCancel
member.summary: An order with this value must fill, but it can partially fill

member.name: F:Com.Lmax.Api.TimeInForce.GoodForDay
member.summary: Represents a limit order, which can be completely unmatched and will not be cancelled until the end of the day

member.name: F:Com.Lmax.Api.TimeInForce.GoodTilCancelled
member.summary: Represents a limit order, which can be completely unmatched and will not be cancelled until manually cancelled

member.name: F:Com.Lmax.Api.TimeInForce.Unknown
member.summary: Represent an unknown time in force value. This is a safety value which will be returned if a new time in force is added to the underlying protocol which the .NET API does not understand.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.LmaxApi
member.summary: The Top-Level interface for the Lmax API. Provides the Login entry point, most of the heavy lifting occurs within Session, so most of the interations with the Lmax Trader platform happen through the .

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.LmaxApi.#ctor(System.String,Com.Lmax.Api.Internal.IHttpInvoker,Com.Lmax.Api.Internal.IXmlParser)
member.summary: Internal: Exposed for testing, use LmaxApi(string urlBase) instead.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.LmaxApi.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct an LmaxApi with the specific Lmax Trader platform to connect to. For testing: 'https://testapi.lmaxtrader.com' and production: 'https://api.lmaxtrader.com'.
member.param: A that contains the url of the system to connect to.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.LmaxApi.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Construct an LmaxApi with the specific Lmax Trader platform to connect to. For testing: 'https://testapi.lmaxtrader.com' and production: 'https://api.lmaxtrader.com'.
member.param: A that contains the url of the system to connect to.
Identifies the client in HTTP requests for diagnostic purposes (25 characters permitted).

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.LmaxApi.#ctor(System.String,Com.Lmax.Api.LmaxApiOptions)
member.summary: Construct an LmaxApi with the specific Lmax Trader platform to connect to. For testing: 'https://testapi.lmaxtrader.com' and production: 'https://api.lmaxtrader.com'.
member.param: A that contains the url of the system to connect to.
Allows for configuration of the LmaxApi.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.LmaxApi.Login(Com.Lmax.Api.LoginRequest,Com.Lmax.Api.OnLogin,Com.Lmax.Api.OnFailure)
member.summary: Login to the Lmax Trader platform. The appropriate handler will be called back on success or failure. The loginCallback should be the main entry point into your trading application. From that point you should add listeners to the session, subscribe to resources that you're interested in, e.g. OrderBooks and call Start on the .
member.param: A that contains your login credentials.
A callback, fired when you are successfully logged in.
A callback, fired when there is a login failure.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.LoginRequest
member.summary: Contains the necessary credential information and product type required connect to the LMAX Trader platform.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.LoginRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Com.Lmax.Api.ProductType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct a login request with the appropriate credential, product type and choose whether or not check the protocol version.
member.param: A contains the username.
A contains the password.
A either CFD_DEMO for testapi and CFD_LIVE for production.

A to ensure that the protocol version used by the client and server are the same. Setting this to
false may cause errors or incorrect behaviour due to protocol changes.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.LoginRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Com.Lmax.Api.ProductType)
member.summary: Construct a login request with the appropriate credential and product type.
member.param: A contains the username.
A contains the password.
A either CFD_DEMO for testapi and CFD_LIVE for production.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.LoginRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Construct a login request with the appropriate credential. Product type will default to CFD_LIVE.
member.param: A contains the username.
A contains the password.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.LoginRequest.WriteTo(Com.Lmax.Api.Internal.Xml.IStructuredWriter)
member.summary: Internal: Output this request.
member.param: The destination for the content of this request

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.LoginRequest.Uri
member.summary: The URI for the login request.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.ProductType
member.summary: The product type used to connect to the LMAX Trader platform.

member.name: F:Com.Lmax.Api.ProductType.CFD_LIVE
member.summary: Selected if connecting to the production environment

member.name: F:Com.Lmax.Api.ProductType.CFD_DEMO
member.summary: Selected if connecting to the test environment

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.MarketData.AggregateHistoricMarketDataRequest
member.summary: A request for market data.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.MarketData.IHistoricMarketDataRequest
member.summary: Marker interface for the different types of requests for historic market data.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.MarketData.AggregateHistoricMarketDataRequest.#ctor(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,Com.Lmax.Api.MarketData.Resolution,Com.Lmax.Api.MarketData.Format,Com.Lmax.Api.MarketData.Option[])
member.summary: Request market data for a given instrument, for a given date range and in a given format. The data returned will be for at least the requested date range. For example, if the user asks for 10 days of data they might get a response containing a whole month, but those 10 days will be contained in the month.
member.param: A unique ID to identify this request
The ID of the instrument to return the market data for
The date and time of the start of the range
The date and time for the end of the range
Granularity - e.g. tick/minute/day
Protocol - e.g CSV, ITCH
The type of prices to be returned

Contains information about trading dates and times
Details on how to calculate risk for this instrument
Information relating to the order book

member.summary: Get information about the underlying instrument.

member.summary: Get all date and time related information for the instrument.

member.summary: Get all of the information relating to risk for this instrument.

member.summary: Get information relating to the commerical aggrements for this instrument.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.UnderlyingInfo
member.summary: The underlying asset of the traded instrument, contain information such as symbol, asset class etc.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.UnderlyingInfo.Symbol
member.summary: Get the text symbol used for the instrument.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.UnderlyingInfo.Isin
member.summary: Get the ISIN of the underlying instrument.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.UnderlyingInfo.AssetClass
member.summary: Get the asset class of the underlying.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CalendarInfo
member.summary: Contains all of the information relating to dates and times during which the instrument is tradeable.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CalendarInfo.StartTime
member.summary: Get the start time of the instrument, this is the time that the instrument will first be available to trade.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CalendarInfo.ExpiryTime
member.summary: Get the DateTime the instrument will expire, mostly relevant for instruments like futures that only exist for a limited time.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CalendarInfo.Open
member.summary: Get the time of day that the market will open (in time zone specified) by this object.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CalendarInfo.Close
member.summary: Get the time of day that the market will close (in time zone specified) by this object.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CalendarInfo.TimeZone
member.summary: Get the timezone in which this calendar operates.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CalendarInfo.TradingDays
member.summary: Get the days of week that the market is open.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.RiskInfo
member.summary: Holds the Risk elements for the instrument.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.RiskInfo.MarginRate
member.summary: Get the margin rate as a percentage for this instrument.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.RiskInfo.MaximumPosition
member.summary: Get the maxium position that can be held by a retail user on this instrument.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookInfo
member.summary: Holds information related to the behaviour of the order book.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookInfo.PriceIncrement
member.summary: Get the price increment in which orders can be placed, i.e. the tick size.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookInfo.QuantityIncrement
member.summary: Get the quantity increment in which orders can be placed.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookInfo.VolatilityBandPercentage
member.summary: Get the retail volatility band for the order book, this limits how far from the spread an order can be placed.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.ContractInfo
member.summary: Holds the information about the contract for this instrument.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.ContractInfo.Currency
member.summary: Get the currency this instrument is traded in.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.ContractInfo.UnitPrice
member.summary: Get the price for a single contract unit.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.ContractInfo.UnitOfMeasure
member.summary: Get the name of the units being traded, e.g. barrels of oil, US dollars

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.ContractInfo.ContractSize
member.summary: Get the contract size.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo
member.summary: Hold information pertaining to the commerical detail of this instrument.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo.MinimumCommission
member.summary: Get the minimum commision applied for a trade on this instrument.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo.AggressiveCommissionRate
member.summary: Get the aggressive commission rate, may be null if commission is charged per contract. The commission charge when the order is on the aggressive side of the trade.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo.PassiveCommissionRate
member.summary: Get the passive commission rate, may be null if commission is charged per contract. The commission charge when the order is on the passive side of the trade.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo.AggressiveCommissionPerContract
member.summary: Get the aggressive commission per contract, may be null if commission is charged using a rate. The commission charge when the order is on the aggressive side of the trade.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo.PassiveCommissionPerContract
member.summary: Get the passive commission per contract, may be null if commission is charged using a rate. The commission charge when the order is on the passive side of the trade.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo.FundingBaseRate
member.summary: Get the base rate used for funding this instrument.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo.DailyInterestRateBasis
member.summary: Get the number of days per year used to calculate the daily interest charged for funding.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo.FundingRate
member.summary: Get the rate used for overnight funding.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo.FundingPremiumPercentage
member.summary: Get the percentage premium added to the funding base rate for overnight funding of long positions on non-FX instruments.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo.FundingReductionPercentage
member.summary: Get the percentage reduction applied to the funding base rate for overnight funding of short positions on non-FX instruments.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo.LongSwapPoints
member.summary: Get the swap points used to calculate overnight interest swap charges for long positions on FX instruments.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.CommercialInfo.ShortSwapPoints
member.summary: Get the swap points used to calculate overnight interest swap charges for short positions on FX instruments.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent
member.summary: The contents of the event raised whenever there is a change to the market data for a given order book.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.HasValuationBidPrice
member.summary: Readonly property to determine if this OrderBook has a valuation bid price. This will only be set if the particalur instrument has been traded.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.HasValuationAskPrice
member.summary: Readonly property to determine if this OrderBook has a valuation ask price. This will only be set if the particalur instrument has been traded.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.ValuationBidPrice
member.summary: Readonly value of the valuation bid price for the OrderBook

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.ValuationAskPrice
member.summary: Readonly value of the valuation ask price for the OrderBook

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.Timestamp
member.summary: The timestamp as number of milliseconds since unix time epoch (1st January 1970) when the market data was updated inside of the exchange.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.BidPrices
member.summary: List of all of the bid prices for an order book. The best price will be at index 0. If there is no liquidity in the market this list will be empty.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.AskPrices
member.summary: List of all of the bid prices for an order book. The best price will be at index 0. If there is no liquidity in the market this list will be empty.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.InstrumentId
member.summary: Instrument Id of the OrderBook, same as the value used in subscribing

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.HasMarketClosePrice
member.summary: Indicate if a Last Market Close Price is available

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.MktClosePrice
member.summary: The Market Close Price for the previous trading session.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.MktClosePriceTimestamp
member.summary: Timestamp as number of milliseconds since unix time epoch (1st January 1970) of the market close of the previous trading session.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.HasLastTradedPrice
member.summary: Indicate if a last traded price is available.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.LastTradedPrice
member.summary: The price of the last trade that occured on this OrderBook.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.HasDailyHighestTradedPrice
member.summary: Indicate if a Highest Daily Traded Price is available, could be false if there have be no trades in the current session.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.DailyHighestTradedPrice
member.summary: The highest price at which a trade occured in this trading session.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.HasDailyLowestTradedPrice
member.summary: Indicate if a Lowest Daily Traded Price is available, could be false if there have be no trades in the current session.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.OrderBookEvent.DailyLowestTradedPrice
member.summary: The lowest price at which a trade occured in this trading session.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.SearchRequest
member.summary: A request to get the system to push out a group of security definitions.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.SearchRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct a request for a security definition. Uses a query string that provides flexible query mechanism. There are 2 main forms of the query string to find a specific instrument the "id: (instrumentId)" form can be used. To do a general search, use a term such as "CURRENCY", which will find all of the currency instruments. A search term like "UK" will find all of the instruments that have "UK" in the name.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.OrderBook.SearchRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Construct a request for a security definition. Uses a query string that provides flexible query mechanism. There are 2 main forms of the query string to find a specific instrument the "id: (instrumentId)" form can be used. To do a general search, use a term such as "CURRENCY", which will find all of the currency instruments. A search term like "UK" will find all of the instruments that have "UK" in the name.

member.summary: Internal: Output this request.
member.param: The destination for the content of this request

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.ClosingOrderSpecification
member.summary: Closing Order Specification. Allows you to place an order which closes out a given quantity, either against an instrument position, or against a specific order.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.ClosingOrderSpecification.#ctor(System.String,System.Int64,System.Nullable{System.Decimal})
member.summary: Construct a ClosingOrderSpecification. This allows you to close a quantity of your position on a given instrument by placing a market order in the opposite direction of your existing position.
member.param: The user-defined correlation id
The id of the instrument for the order book to close position on
The quantity to close. A signed value, where the sign indicates the side of the market that order is placed. Positive implies a buy order, where as negative is a sell

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.ClosingOrderSpecification.#ctor(System.String,System.Int64,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Decimal})
member.summary: Construct a ClosingOrderSpecification. This allows you to close a quantity of your position on a given instrument by placing a market order in the opposite direction of your existing position.
member.param: The user-defined correlation id
The id of the instrument for the order book to close position on
the instruction ID of the original order to close
The quantity to close. A signed value, where the sign indicates the side of the market that order is placed. Positive implies a buy order, where as negative is a sell

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.ClosingOrderSpecification.WriteTo(Com.Lmax.Api.Internal.Xml.IStructuredWriter)
member.summary: Internal: Output this request.
member.param: The destination for the content of this request

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.ClosingOrderSpecification.Quantity
member.summary: Get/Set the of the order, the sign infers the side of the order. A positive value is a buy, negative indicates sell.

member.summary: Get/Set the instrument id that the order should be placed on.

member.summary: Get/Set the of the order, the sign infers the side of the order. A positive value is a buy, negative indicates sell.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.OrderSpecification.StopLossPriceOffset
member.summary: Get/Set the stop loss offset for the order, null to indicates that the order does not have a stop less.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.OrderSpecification.StopProfitPriceOffset

member.summary: Get/Set the for the order.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.LimitOrderSpecification.#ctor(System.String,System.Int64,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,Com.Lmax.Api.TimeInForce,System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal})
member.summary: Construct a Limit Order that contains a stop loss and/or stop profit price offset.
member.param: The client specified instruction id, should be unique for an account.
The instrument id of the OrderBook to place the order on.
The price for the order to be placed into the book if not aggressively filled.
The size of the limit order. The side of the order is inferred from the sign of the quantity. A positive value is a buy, negative is sell.
A that describes the behaviour of the order if not fully filled
The stop loss offset, set this to null to not specify a stop loss.
The stop profit offset, set this to null to not specify a stop profit.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.LimitOrderSpecification.#ctor(System.String,System.Int64,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,Com.Lmax.Api.TimeInForce)
member.summary: Construct a Limit Order that does not contains a stop loss and/or stop profit price offset.
member.param: The client specified instruction id, should be unique for an account.
The instrument id of the OrderBook to place the order on.
The price for the order to be placed into the book if not aggressively filled.
The size of the limit order. The side of the order is inferred from the sign of the quantity. A positive value is a buy, negative is sell.
A that describes the behaviour of the order if not fully filled

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.LimitOrderSpecification.Price
member.summary: Get/Set the price of the order, allows order instance to be reused.

member.param: The client specified instruction id, should be unique for an account.
The instrument id of the OrderBook to place the order on.
The size of the market order. The side of the order is inferred from the sign of the quantity. A positive value is a buy, negative is sell.
A that describes the behaviour of the order if not fully filled
The stop loss offset, set this to null to not specify a stop loss.
The stop profit offset, set this to null to not specify a stop profit.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.MarketOrderSpecification.#ctor(System.String,System.Int64,System.Decimal,Com.Lmax.Api.TimeInForce)

member.summary: Get the id of the instruction that placed the order. Can be used to correlate with the original request.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.OrderId
member.summary: Get the id of the order.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.InstrumentId
member.summary: Get the id of the instrument on which the order was placed.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.AccountId
member.summary: Get the id of the account that placed the order.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.OrderType
member.summary: Get the type of the order.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.Quantity
member.summary: Get the quantity of the order.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.FilledQuantity
member.summary: Get the quantity of this order that has filled.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.LimitPrice
member.summary: Get the limit price for this order, will be null if this is not a limit order.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.StopPrice
member.summary: Get the stop price for this order, will be null if this is not a stop order.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.CancelledQuantity
member.summary: Get the quantity of this order that has been cancelled.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.StopLossOffset
member.summary: Get the distance from the StopReferencePrice at which the stop loss order trigger will be placed. Will be null if no stop loss requested for this order.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.StopProfitOffset
member.summary: Get the distance from the StopReferencePrice at which the stop profit order will be placed. Will be null if no stop profit requested for this order.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.StopReferencePrice
member.summary: The price relative to which stop loss and stop profit prices will be calculated. Will be null for unmatched market orders.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.Commission
member.summary: The commulative commssion that you have aleady been charged for this order.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.Order.TimeInForce
member.summary: The time in force for this order

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.OrderSubscriptionRequest
member.summary: Request to subscribe to order events.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.StopOrderSpecification
member.summary: Stop order request. Can be reused, but the instructionID needs to be reset every time it is submitted.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.StopOrderSpecification.#ctor(System.String,System.Int64,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,Com.Lmax.Api.TimeInForce,System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal})
member.summary: Construct a Stop order that contains a stop loss and/or stop profit price offset.
member.param: The client specified instruction id, should be unique for an account.
The instrument id of the OrderBook to place the order on.
The trigger price which will cause the market order to be placed.
The size of the Market order. The side of the order is inferred from the sign of the quantity. A positive value is a buy, negative is sell.
A that describes the time the stop will remain valid options, GoodForDay and GoodTilCancelled
The stop loss offset, set this to null to not specify a stop loss.
The stop profit offset, set this to null to not specify a stop profit.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.StopOrderSpecification.#ctor(System.String,System.Int64,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,Com.Lmax.Api.TimeInForce)
member.summary: Construct a Stop order that contains a stop loss and/or stop profit price offset.
member.param: The client specified instruction id, should be unique for an account.
The instrument id of the OrderBook to place the order on.
The trigger price which will cause the market order to be placed.
The size of the Market order. The side of the order is inferred from the sign of the quantity. A positive value is a buy, negative is sell.
A that describes the time the stop will remain valid options, GoodForDay and GoodTilCancelled

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Order.StopOrderSpecification.WriteTo(Com.Lmax.Api.Internal.Xml.IStructuredWriter)
member.summary: Internal: Output this request.
member.param: The destination for the content of this request

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.Position.PositionEvent
member.summary: Represents a position on a instrument, held by the account. A number of fields refer to the term 'cost'. Cost is price x quantity. A position is an aggregate view of all of the open and unfilled orders

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Position.PositionEvent.#ctor(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Create an object that contains the details of the changes that occurred to a position.
member.param: The ID of the account that holds the position
The instrument the position is on
The cost of the unfilled sell positions against this instrument
The cost of the unfilled buy positions against this instrument
The filled quantity of this position, signed, e.g. sell is a negative value
The cost accumulated so far for holiding this position
The cost of opening this position

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Position.PositionEvent.AccountId
member.summary: Get the id for the account that the position belongs to.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Position.PositionEvent.InstrumentId
member.summary: Get the id for the instrument that the position pertains to.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Position.PositionEvent.ShortUnfilledCost
member.summary: Get the short unfilled cost for this position. I.e. the cost of sell orders that have not filled.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Position.PositionEvent.LongUnfilledCost
member.summary: Get the long unfilled cost for this position. I.e. the cost of buy orders that have not filled.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Position.PositionEvent.OpenQuantity
member.summary: Get the net open quantity for this position.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Position.PositionEvent.CumulativeCost
member.summary: The total cost incurred over the lifetime of the position.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Position.PositionEvent.OpenCost
member.summary: The cost to establish the current open position.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.Position.PositionSubscriptionRequest
member.summary: Request to subscribe to position events.

member.name: T:Com.Lmax.Api.Reject.InstructionRejectedEvent
member.summary: An event that contains the detail of the rejection of an instruction. E.g. INSUFFICIENT_LIQUIDITY.

member.name: M:Com.Lmax.Api.Reject.InstructionRejectedEvent.#ctor(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an event containing the details of why an instruction was rejected
member.param: The ID of the instruction that was rejected
The ID of the account that sent the instruction
The ID of the instrument the instruction related to
The description of why the instruction was rejected

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Reject.InstructionRejectedEvent.InstructionId
member.summary: Get the id of the instruction that was rejected.

member.summary: Get the id of the account that placed the instruction.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Reject.InstructionRejectedEvent.InstrumentId
member.summary: Get the id of the instrument that the instruction was placed on.

member.name: P:Com.Lmax.Api.Reject.InstructionRejectedEvent.Reason
